subject: p14295224
History: With history of asthma, s/p esophagectom for esophageal cancer presening with cough and chest pain.
Findings: PA and lateral chest radiograph is compared to prior study dated. There has been little interval change with no focal consolidation concerning for pneumonia identified. Lungs are hyperinflated. Patient is status post radiation therapy to the right lung. Previously seen right lower lung sub cm nodular opacity is not definitely visualized. Cardiomediastinal contours are stable. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Visualized osseous structures demonstrates no acute abnormality.
Impression: No acute intrathoracic abnormality. Hyperinflated lungs with chronic radiation changes.
